Module edu.uoc.trip
Package edu.uoc.trip.controller

Class Game

java.lang.Object
edu.uoc.trip.controller.Game
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
Controller class of the game. It is the middleware (or bridge) between the model and view classes.
This class is called from the view classes in order to access/modify the model data.
Author:
David García-Solórzano

      Maximum quantity of levels that the game has.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game​(java.lang.String fileFolder) throws java.io.IOException
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      fileFolder - Folder name where the configuration/level files are.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - When there is a problem while retrieving number of levels

  • Method Details

    • setFileFolder

      private void setFileFolder​(java.lang.String fileFolder)
      Setter of the attribute "fileFolder".
      Parameters:
      fileFolder - Folder name where the configuration/level files are.

    • getFileFolder

      private java.lang.String getFileFolder()
      Getter of the attribute "fileFolder".
      Returns:
      Value of the attribute "fileFolder".

    • getBoardSize

      public int getBoardSize()
      Returns the number of rows and columns of the board of the current level. The board is an NxN square.
      Returns:
      The number of rows and columns of the board of the current level.

    • getDifficulty

      public LevelDifficulty getDifficulty()
      Returns the difficulty of the current level.
      Returns:
      The difficulty of the current level.

    • getNumMoves

      public int getNumMoves()
      Returns the number of moves that have been done to solve the current level.
      Returns:
      Number of moves that the player has done to solve the current level.

    • isFinished

      private boolean isFinished()
      Indicates if the game is finished (true) or not (false). The game is finished when the attribute "currentLevel" is equals to attribute "maxLevels".
      Returns:
      True if there are no more levels and therefore the game is finished. Otherwise, false.

    • getCurrentLevel

      public int getCurrentLevel()
      Getter of the attribute "currentLevel".
      Returns:
      Value of the attribute "currentLevel" that indicates which level we are playing.

    • nextLevel

      public boolean nextLevel() throws LevelException
      Checks if there is a new level to play and loads it.
      If the game is finished, it returns false. Otherwise, it returns true.
      Returns:
      True if there is a next level, and it has been loaded correctly. Otherwise, it returns false.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When there is a level exception/problem.

    • loadLevel

      private void loadLevel() throws LevelException
      Loads a new level by using the value of attribute "currentLevel". The pattern of the filename is: fileFolder+"level" + numberLevel + ".txt".
      Throws:
      LevelException - When there is a level exception/problem.

    • isLevelSolved

      public boolean isLevelSolved() throws LevelException
      Checks if the level is solved, i.e. there is a path from the starting cell to the ending cell.
      Returns:
      true if this level is beaten, otherwise false.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When there is a level exception/problem.

    • getCell

      public Cell getCell​(Coordinate coord) throws LevelException
      Returns the cell that is in the given coordinate.
      Parameters:
      coord - Coordinate of the cell that we want to retrieve.
      Returns:
      Cell which is the position/coordinate "coord".
      Throws:
      LevelException - When the coordinate is invalid.

    • getCell

      public Cell getCell​(int row, int col) throws LevelException
      Returns the cell that is in the given (row,col).
      Parameters:
      row - Row of the cell that we want to retrieve.
      col - Column of the cell that we want to retrieve.
      Returns:
      Cell which is the position/coordinate (row,col).
      Throws:
      LevelException - When the coordinate is invalid.

    • getBoardText

      public java.lang.String getBoardText()
      Returns a String with the board of the current level in textual format.
      Returns:
      Text-based board of the current level.

    • swap

      public void swap​(Coordinate first, Coordinate second) throws LevelException
      Swaps the cells that are in the two given coordinates.
      Parameters:
      first - Object representing the coordinate of the first cell.
      second - Object representing the coordinate of the second cell.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When any coordinate is incorrect or the swap was unsuccessful.

    • rotate

      public void rotate​(Coordinate cellCoord) throws LevelException
      Rotates the cell which is in the coordinate "cellCoord".
      Parameters:
      cellCoord - Object representing the coordinate of the cell.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When the coordinate is incorrect or the cell in the coordinate cannot be rotated.

    • reload

      public void reload() throws LevelException
      Reloads the current level, i.e. load the level again.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When there is a level exception/problem.
